welcome_message: ðŸ˜Š Welcome to our Crop Information Hub! Find everything you need to know about crops, including their ideal growing conditions, soil preferences, and current market prices. Explore now to enhance your farming experience!

rice.description: Rice is a staple food for a large part of the world's human population.
rice.soilInfo: Loamy soil, clayey loam, and clayey soil are the best for growing rice.
rice.growthConditions: Requires high temperature, high humidity, and an annual rainfall of above 100 cm.

wheat.description: Wheat is a grass widely cultivated for its seed, a cereal grain which is a worldwide staple food.
wheat.soilInfo: Well-drained loamy and clayey soil with a pH range of 6 to 7.5.
wheat.growthConditions: Requires cool, moist weather during the growing period and warm, dry weather during harvest.

maize.description: Maize is a cereal grain first domesticated by indigenous peoples in southern Mexico about 10,000 years ago.
maize.soilInfo: Well-drained, fertile soils with a pH range of 5.8 to 7.8.
maize.growthConditions: Requires warm weather with temperatures between 21Â°C and 30Â°C.

barley.description: Barley is a major cereal grain grown in temperate climates globally.
barley.soilInfo: Well-drained loamy soil with a pH range of 6 to 7.5.
barley.growthConditions: Requires cool and dry weather, particularly during the growing season.

millets.description: Millets are a group of highly variable small-seeded grasses, widely grown around the world as cereal crops.
millets.soilInfo: Well-drained loamy to sandy soils with a pH range of 5.5 to 7.0.
millets.growthConditions: Requires hot and dry weather, suitable for arid and semi-arid regions.

sorghum.description: Sorghum is a genus of flowering plants in the grass family Poaceae.
sorghum.soilInfo: Sorghum grows well in sandy loam to loam soils.
sorghum.growthConditions: Requires warm temperatures and is tolerant to drought conditions.

soybean.description: Soybean is a species of legume native to East Asia, widely grown for its edible bean.
soybean.soilInfo: Well-drained loamy soil with a pH range of 6 to 7.
soybean.growthConditions: Requires warm weather, with temperatures between 20Â°C and 30Â°C.

groundnut.description: Groundnut, also known as peanut, is a legume crop grown mainly for its edible seeds.
groundnut.soilInfo: Light sandy loam soils with good drainage.
groundnut.growthConditions: Requires warm climate with 20Â°C to 30Â°C temperature.

cotton.description: Cotton is a soft, fluffy staple fiber that grows in a boll, or protective case, around the seeds of cotton plants.
cotton.soilInfo: Well-drained loamy soils with a pH range of 5.8 to 8.0.
cotton.growthConditions: Requires warm climate with temperatures between 21Â°C and 30Â°C.

sugarcane.description: Sugarcane is a tropical, perennial grass that forms lateral shoots at the base to produce multiple stems.
sugarcane.soilInfo: Deep, rich loamy soil with good drainage.
sugarcane.growthConditions: Requires hot and humid climate with temperatures between 20Â°C and 40Â°C.

tea.description: Tea is an aromatic beverage commonly prepared by pouring hot or boiling water over cured or fresh tea leaves.
tea.soilInfo: Deep, well-drained loamy soils with a pH range of 4.5 to 5.5.
tea.growthConditions: Requires warm and humid climate with well-distributed rainfall.

coffee.description: Coffee is a brewed drink prepared from roasted coffee beans, the seeds of berries from certain Coffea species.
coffee.soilInfo: Rich, well-drained loamy soils with a pH range of 6 to 6.5.
coffee.growthConditions: Requires warm climate with moderate rainfall and temperatures between 15Â°C and 25Â°C.

banana.description: Banana is an edible fruit, botanically a berry, produced by several kinds of large herbaceous flowering plants.
banana.soilInfo: Rich, well-drained loamy soils with good moisture content.
banana.growthConditions: Requires warm climate with high humidity and well-distributed rainfall.

mango.description: Mango is a juicy stone fruit produced from numerous species of tropical trees belonging to the flowering plant genus Mangifera.
mango.soilInfo: Well-drained loamy to sandy loam soils.
mango.growthConditions: Requires warm, dry weather during flowering and fruit setting and hot, humid weather during fruit development.

papaya.description: Papaya is the fruit of the plant Carica papaya, and is one of the 22 accepted species in the genus Carica of the family Caricaceae.
papaya.soilInfo: Rich, well-drained loamy soils with a pH range of 6 to 6.5.
papaya.growthConditions: Requires warm climate with well-distributed rainfall and temperatures between 21Â°C and 33Â°C.

pineapple.description: Pineapple is a tropical plant with an edible fruit and the most economically significant plant in the family Bromeliaceae.
pineapple.soilInfo: Well-drained, sandy loam soils with a pH range of 4.5 to 6.5.
pineapple.growthConditions: Requires warm and humid climate with temperatures between 23Â°C and 32Â°C.

apple.description: Apple is an edible fruit produced by an apple tree, which is cultivated worldwide as a fruit tree, and is the most widely grown species in the genus Malus.
apple.soilInfo: Well-drained loamy soils with a pH range of 6 to 6.5.
apple.growthConditions: Requires cold climate with temperatures between 21Â°C and 24Â°C.

grapes.description: Grapes are a fruit, botanically a berry, of the deciduous woody vines of the flowering plant genus Vitis.
grapes.soilInfo: Deep, well-drained loamy soils with a pH range of 6 to 7.
grapes.growthConditions: Requires warm and dry climate with temperatures between 15Â°C and 35Â°C.

orange.description: Orange is the fruit of various citrus species in the family Rutaceae; it primarily refers to Citrus Ã— sinensis, which is also called sweet orange.
orange.soilInfo: Well-drained sandy loam soils with a pH range of 6 to 7.5.
orange.growthConditions: Requires warm climate with well-distributed rainfall and temperatures between 20Â°C and 30Â°C.

lemon.description: Lemon is a species of small evergreen tree in the flowering plant family Rutaceae, native to Asia.
lemon.soilInfo: Well-drained loamy soils with a pH range of 6 to 7.
lemon.growthConditions: Requires warm climate with ample sunlight and temperatures between 20Â°C and 30Â°C.
